summary: This bill, the NRC Office of Public Engagement and Participation Act of 2025, mandates the establishment of an Office of Public Engagement and Participation within the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC). The Office's responsibilities include supporting public participation in NRC proceedings, acting as a liaison with public interest advocates, providing guidance and assistance, coordinating financial assistance to participants, increasing opportunities for public virtual participation, and conducting other activities to facilitate transparency. It establishes an Intervenor Trust Fund to provide compensation to participants facing financial hardship. The bill aims to enhance public engagement and transparency within the NRC.
